Patch Set 23:

(2 comments)

Patch Set 23:

(2 comments)

Lets avoid adding anything to the /login API going forward.  This is a new feature, we shouldn't need to add it to every API.  The UI now supports logging in through "normal" Redfish, so we shouldn't really need to update this anymore.
ok, looks like GUI login page still uses /login API, so i have updated /login as well.

The GUI no longer uses /login.  it was moved to SessionService about a month ago:

https://github.com/openbmc/webui-vue/commit/1ff8e89fd2397c468ab0237158e5aeeff2692413
Done
Lets make this take a std::optional, just so it's clear if the user provided it, or if the user provided an empty string.
agree, will make this change
Done

This doesn’t seem right.  The token provided is just string appended?  Any documentation for this?  That seems like it would have weird behaviors, where if the user attached an OTP at the end of the password, it would be parsed the same.

google pam authenticator support these options like forward_pass, user_first_pass to tell PAM modules how each google-authenticator PAM module can pick corresponding  OTP token for authentication.

https://github.com/google/google-authenticator-libpam?tab=readme-ov-file#try_first_pass--use_first_pass--forward_pass

PAM configuration file will have this configuration
auth required pam_google_authenticator.so forward_pass nullok

That's documented as for:
"Some PAM clients cannot prompt the user for more than just the password."

bmcweb IS the Pam client, so we can implement whatever we want.  We shouldn't need to set forward_pass, we should be able to return both prompts.

Note, that the current logic just assumes that everything is asking for a password.  For OTP, you'd go modify this code here:

https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/b729096d0a787abe2a7e8a9a2d1ea12b5e1540fb/include/pam_authenticate.hpp#L36

To handle both an OTP and a password (if it's requested).

I have update pamFunctionConversation() function to handle both Password and OTP.
authentication works with or without TOTP MFA authentication.
but with these pamFunctionConversation() changes, there are changes required for password change operation as well.
Done
Nullptr dereference.  token is a std::optional, it's not guaranteed to be provided by a user.

already addressed Nullptr dereference in latest patchset
but I think its good to take token as  std::optional.
Done
This is a nullptr dereference.  Nowhere do we check if tokenIt == end()
this code is remove
token and token.has_value() are the same thing. This branch can never be hit.
Done

Would you mind helping to review: https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/69470

It might also help make this code easier to write.

sure will take a look at this commit.
Thank you

I pushed a stack of untested (but code review correct) patches here:

https://github.com/edtanous/bmcweb/tree/token_support

That I think implement most of the code review comments.  Feel free to use them, or come up with your own.

https://github.com/edtanous/bmcweb/tree/token_support

Hi Ed
I looked these changes, looks good but I see pam errors while creating redfish session, I will debug and update this commit
Aug 19 16:50:51 romulus bmcweb[210]: pam_unix(webserver:auth): conversation failed
Aug 19 16:50:51 romulus bmcweb[210]: pam_unix(webserver:auth): auth could not identify password for [root]

There's probably a bug somewhere.  I didn't run it at all.

Ideally we'd have some unit tests, but up to you if you want to add them.
the exact string match for password prompt and verification code prompt does not work. With latest patch TOTP & password authentication works fine and password change also works.
std::nullopt
Ack
Done
std::nullopt
Ack
Done
I suspect we should separate this and make a different one for password change, given that they support different arguments.
yes, I will give a try
Done

There's no array size checks.  If the function conversation returns more than 2 requests, this will overflow.

Also, this is technically a char*[2], not a char**
agreed, i need to work on this code to handle error cases..
Done
Why not an exact match?
exact match does not work, looks like pam prompts a string more than just "Password" or "verification code" strings
what's the additional?  I'm assuming it's something like Password\n>
looks like it will be "Password: " and "Verification code: "
Can we match on those strings then?
I've changed to those strings.  Please review.
Why do we check for either of these strings?  Presumably Google authenticator only asks for one?
yeah, this will asked by PAM module which supports TOTP authentication
Right, but which one does Google authenticator ask for?  Is TOTP a different type of plugin?  If they're different, an inline comment about which each string is for would help a lot.
Google authenticator prompt with "Verification code: " string, some other TOTP plugins may prompt differently
Can we get an inline comment for which strings match with which?  It's really non-obvious and would make it hard to test.
Added comment.
Should we make a class with this data to pass in on line 85?  That seems less error prone than an array of char pointers.
Done
Lets stack this commit on top of https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/69470, just so we separate the refactor from the new functionality a little.
done
why can't we move this code to PasswordData? delegating the prompt parsing to it will make is easier for any future enhancements/customisation and better encapsulation.

Which code specifically?

> make is easier for any future enhancements/customisation and better encapsulation.

I'm not really sure what this means.  If you could make more clear which code you think should go into the PasswordData struct, that might help, or maybe propose what you'd prefer to see?
plase see here https://godbolt.org/z/d671rbMzW for what I meant

Aside from the inheritence between PasswordData : PamData (which there's not really any use of),
I could see the argument that putting a makeResponse method on PasswordData would be clearer.

Up to Ravi if he wants to change it in this patch, or if we just treat that as an additional cleanup later.
lets do these additional improvements later.

I did the inheritance because I thought we need different struct for pamUpdatePassword. where the data contains only the password. And it is easy to extend in case if we have more prompts for different MFA.
ok
if we do the delegation as commented above then we could use a generic conversation function.

I have no idea what this means, and I'd prefer to keep the two conversation functions separate, because they accept different arguments and process different outputs.  If there's a way to consolidate that, fine, but if the change password conversation asks for a token, it shouldn't respond.

> do the delegation as commented 

I don't know what "delegation" means in this context.
I actually ended up removing this.  THere's not enough difference between the two that it matters.  I was expecting significantly more difference.
i was thinking about doing something like this https://godbolt.org/z/d671rbMzW
If we use std::string_view here instead of std::string, we'll avoid allocations, and the find can be replaced with message.starts_with(passwordPrompt) which I think is more correct
This looks like an issue.  I think this can be deleted now that we're using srtdup below.
This code is gone now.
This code looks fine to me.  Looking for others to help review/test
Code looks correct.  Commit message could use some more details on the other commits required to make this work, and which commits it was tested against, but code now looks fine to me.

Hi Ed
code looks good. I have tested this latest patch set, it works as expected.

Here is test results

Basic redfish login works
curl --insecure -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X POST -D headers.txt https://${bmc}/redfish/v1/SessionService/Sessions -d '{"UserName" :"root", "Password": "0penBmc"}'
{
  "@odata.id": "/redfish/v1/SessionService/Sessions/9qPyD09C1Y",
  "@odata.type": "#Session.v1_7_0.Session",
  "ClientOriginIPAddress": "10.0.2.2",
  "Description": "Manager User Session",
  "Id": "9qPyD09C1Y",
  "Name": "User Session",
  "Roles": [
    "Administrator"
  ],
  "UserName": "root"
}

In case random Token passed, Token parameter will be ignored when google-authenticator is not configured, authentication still works.
curl --insecure -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X POST -D headers.txt https://${bmc}/redfish/v1/SessionService/Sessions -d '{"UserName" :"root", "Password": "0penBmc","Token": "123456"}'
{
  "@odata.id": "/redfish/v1/SessionService/Sessions/dEp900GWc9",
  "@odata.type": "#Session.v1_7_0.Session",
  "ClientOriginIPAddress": "10.0.2.2",
  "Description": "Manager User Session",
  "Id": "dEp900GWc9",
  "Name": "User Session",
  "Roles": [
    "Administrator"
  ],
  "UserName": "root"
}

Tested with google-authenticator configuration:

Authentication works with valid TOTP token
curl --insecure -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X POST -D headers.txt https://${bmc}/redfish/v1/SessionService/Sessions -d '{"UserName" :"root", "Password": "0penBmc","Token": "831050"}'
{
  "@odata.id": "/redfish/v1/SessionService/Sessions/JtotnXielJ",
  "@odata.type": "#Session.v1_7_0.Session",
  "ClientOriginIPAddress": "10.0.2.2",
  "Description": "Manager User Session",
  "Id": "JtotnXielJ",
  "Name": "User Session",
  "Roles": [
    "Administrator"
  ],
  "UserName": "root"
}

Authentication fails with invalid TOTP token

curl --insecure -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X POST -D headers.txt https://${bmc}/redfish/v1/SessionService/Sessions -d '{"UserName" :"root", "Password": "0penBmc","Token": "831050"}'
{
  "error": {
    "@Message.ExtendedInfo": [
      {
        "@odata.type": "#Message.v1_1_1.Message",
        "Message": "While accessing the resource at '/redfish/v1/SessionService/Sessions', the service received an authorization error 'Invalid username or password'.",
        "MessageArgs": [
          "/redfish/v1/SessionService/Sessions",
          "Invalid username or password"
        ],
        "MessageId": "Base.1.18.1.ResourceAtUriUnauthorized",
        "MessageSeverity": "Critical",
        "Resolution": "Ensure that the appropriate access is provided for the service in order for it to access the URI."
      }
    ],
    "code": "Base.1.18.1.ResourceAtUriUnauthorized",
    "message": "While accessing the resource at '/redfish/v1/SessionService/Sessions', the service received an authorization error 'Invalid username or password'."
  }
}
lets get this commit merged

I think we need to modify this error message to include Token parameter as well
"Invalid username or password or token"

we should update to just "invalid credentials" or something like that.  We don't know if a token was provided.

FWIW, I"m ok with the message as it is.  the Token is a kind of "Password"
ok, lets keep it as it is.
FYI, I changed these to string view, and the next line to starts_with.  Please review and test if it still works for you.

this not a safe cast in case of pamUpdatePassword, where we are passing const char*. The proposal I made make it type-safe as we always pass PamData pointer . Now it is working because the memory offset of password 0. But become buggy if some once changes the order of token and password.

ok got your point, looks like you have code ready to address this right
please push a commit.
